image.altText: People walk past a tram and a bus stopped on a busy road under a blue sky.

props.synopsis: Law and order and the cost of living are front of mind for voters heading to the polls in the seats of Prahran and Werribee today, posing a major test for the Victorian Labor government.

title.children: Crime, hip pocket the key issues as Victorians cast votes in by-election

image.altText: Fire union secretary Peter Marshall pictured in his uniform speaking at a rally.

props.synopsis: Fire union secretary Peter Marshall collected total pay of more than $985,000 last year after cashing in his leave entitlements, documents show.

title.children: Victorian fire union boss paid almost $1m due to leave entitlements

image.altText: Generic AFP Badge

props.synopsis: A 33-year-old Melbourne man has been charged with allegedly making death threats and antisemitic comments to a federal MP.

title.children: Man charged over death threats, antisemitic abuse of MP

image.altText: A "Pam the Bird" mural is seen on the side of an apartment building.

props.synopsis: It's the divisive artwork that has "blown people's minds away" and left others fuming. In court this week, police revealed the inner workings of the man allegedly behind "Pam the Bird".

title.children: The police mission to hunt down 'Pam the Bird'

image.altText: A lady in a black dress and glasses stands in front of a wall of posters.

props.synopsis: The owners of Bendigo's Trash Cult record and live music store feared the gig was up when a licensing error threatened to draw the curtains on their music venue.

title.children: Beloved Bendigo music venue saved by licensing backflip

image.altText: Brad Battin speaks to media at Parliament House in Melbourne. He stands in front of a dark background.

props.synopsis: Victorian Opposition Leader Brad Battin says systemic changes are needed to deal with youth justice offenders to protect the community, in a wide-ranging interview about the Liberal Party's priorities.

title.children: Victorian Liberal leader won't have a 'lock them up' youth justice approach

image.altText: A masked person holding a sledgehammer and a head severed from a statue.

props.synopsis: Police say images circulating online that appear to show busts of past prime ministers stolen from Ballarat Botanical Gardens indicate the "thinking capacity" of those responsible is "fairly low-end".

title.children: Vandal photographed with head severed from statue of PM

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens who have been hospitalised in Thailand

props.synopsis: Laos has failed to accept "consistent" offers by Australian Federal Police to assist the investigation into the methanol poisoning deaths of Australian teenagers Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles.

title.children: Laos has not accepted AFP offers to aid methanol poisoning investigation

image.altText: Max King stands with his hands on his hips

props.synopsis: Max King, Jack Sinclair and Mason Wood have all suffered injuries and been sent for scans after a training session at St Kilda.

title.children: Training ground carnage as Saints trio injured

image.altText: A collapsed wind turbine.

props.synopsis: A structural engineer says the blades of a wind turbine are designed to last 20 years and built to withstand winds of at least 108kph.

title.children: Wind turbine collapse in Victoria 'unacceptable', engineer says

image.altText: Three police officers stand beside an ambulance and a fire truck in a street taped off with blue and white police tape.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a 30-year-old man over the death of a man in St Kilda on Wednesday night at a building known to be inhabited by squatters.

title.children: Police question man over the death of a man at St Kilda building

image.altText: A family poses for a photo in front of a temple in Indonesia

props.synopsis: Lily Lumintang was reading an ABC story about her family's plea to remain in Australia when her lawyer called to say Home Affairs had granted their family visas, allowing them to avoid deportation and remain in Australia.

title.children: Indonesian family's Australian residency approved after ABC inquiries

image.altText: A person stands on the top of Mount Wellington wearing warm clothes.

props.synopsis: Tasmania is the "healthiest" place to live, according to a new study. But while the island's state government is keen to draw attention to the result, experts are cautioning against reading too much into it.

title.children: Australia's 'healthiest' place result needs a closer look, say experts

image.altText: Journalists come up with plan to stop job cuts at the Newcastle Herald and Illawarra Mercury.

props.synopsis: Australian Community Media plans to move all mastheads, including Newcastle Herald and Canberra Times, to one print publication a week as it adapts a new publishing model.

title.children: Newspaper publisher ACM plans to cut all mastheads to one print edition per week

image.altText: A fuzzy dark shot from above of a police officer in rescue gear and a paragliders parachute in a tree.

props.synopsis: Police say the paraglider had a "catastrophic" equipment failure in high winds and had to make an emergency landing in a 15-metre-high tree in Victoria's north-east.

title.children: Police release video of 'extreme' tree-top paraglider rescue

image.altText: A man playing a soccer game with the ball just in front of him and several opposition players near him

props.synopsis: Afghans in northern Victoria say Shepparton's Nations Cup soccer tournament provides a sense of connection to locals and a reason to celebrate during difficult times for their country.

title.children: Multicultural soccer comp 'a beautiful thing' for Afghans in Victoria

image.altText: Matthew Stafford prepares to throw the ball for the LA Rams in an NFL match.

props.synopsis: The NFL confirms it will play its first regular-season match in Australia at the MCG next year, with the Los Angeles Rams to feature in the historic occasion.

title.children: Melbourne to host NFL match at MCG in 2026 as part of multi-year commitment

image.altText: Two Jewish men dressed in black coats and wearing hats facing a fenced-off synagogue next to flowers and a We Will Rebuild sign

props.synopsis: Federal Labor has agreed to Coalition demands on mandatory minimum jail sentences, paving the way to pass the government's Hate Crimes bill in parliament.

title.children: Labor buckles to pressure over mandatory sentences for terror offences

image.altText: A close up of the back half of a police van which has the police badge and triple zero icons on the side of the vehicle

props.synopsis: A private company that uses GPS tracking to monitor offenders released into the Victorian community on bail has suddenly closed, with Victoria Police confirming eight "current matters" are impacted by the shut down.

title.children: 'Unacceptable': Closure of bail-monitoring company to be investigated

image.altText: Mr Broadbent sits in a chair wearing a suit and tie as he is interviewed.

props.synopsis: Mr Broadbent cited "unprecedented" and "uncertain" times as the key factors behind his decision, and insisted he still had the stamina to carry out his duties.

title.children: Former Liberal MP who refused COVID vaccine to run as independent

image.altText: Troy Selwood of the Lions runs with the ball

props.synopsis: Former Brisbane Lions player Troy Selwood, brother of Geelong premiership captain Joel, has died aged 40.

title.children: Family 'heartbroken' by sudden death of former AFL player Troy Selwood

image.altText: Pam the Bird graffiti on the side of a Melbourne train.

props.synopsis: The man accused of spray-painting "Pam the Bird" graffiti around Melbourne has been denied bail and now faces the prospect of languishing in jail for 18 months until a trial.

title.children: Alleged graffiti creator denied bail and may have to wait 18 months for trial

image.altText: Confetti drops on to a stage as esports players in green and black hold up a trophy.

props.synopsis: Australia will hold a major competition this year in Melbourne, as other large-scale events are cancelled. But the grassroots-level competition still has a healthy community and level of interest.

title.children: Australian esports is 'dying' despite strong community interest

image.altText: A large lightning bolt hits the ground at night with city lights and a bridge illuminated.

props.synopsis: Dry lightning strikes have been blamed for causing a number of bushfires across Victoria. But what's the difference between dry and wet lightning?

title.children: What is dry lightning and how does it start bushfires?

image.altText: Holly McNamara celebrates

props.synopsis: Melbourne City have smashed Western United 5-1, with star attacker Holly McNamara scoring a hat-trick after her Matildas recall following a third ACL injury and more than 12 months out the game.

title.children: City striker celebrates Matildas recall after ACL injury with hat-trick

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses and holding a beer bottle in his right hand

props.synopsis: David Graham Berry pleads not guilty to eight charges over a crash that killed a 56-year-old man in Victoria's Goulburn Valley last year.

title.children: Man to fight charges over alleged hit-and-run death of motorcyclist

image.altText: A collapsed wind turbine

props.synopsis: Authorities are working to investigate the collapse of a wind turbine at the Berrybank Wind Farm, west of Geelong.

title.children: Wind turbine falls in Victorian storms prompting call for safety audit

image.altText: A large rainbow flag is waved in the air.

props.synopsis: The government will need to rely on the crossbench to pass proposed legislation, with the opposition concerned those claiming a political stance will be able to circumvent the laws.

title.children: Plans to expand Victoria's hate speech laws face opposition road block

image.altText: A street post with one way pointing to 'Historic Way' and the other way pointing to 'Offensive Place'

props.synopsis: Places and their names can hold different meanings for different people, but what happens when those in a community are uncomfortable with a historical figure or the association a place is named after?

title.children: Hundreds of places in Australia contain this 'racist slur' that experts want changed

image.altText: an illustration of an unidentified young girl wearing a white dress facing away

props.synopsis: Two former homeschoolers who say they were denied a proper education are calling for mandatory home visits. But advocates say tighter regulations aren't the answer.

title.children: Why Samantha feels homeschooling robbed her of a 'proper education'

image.altText: Aerial vision shows a collapsed house.

props.synopsis: The state government announces an independent inquiry into the cause of a landslide south east of Melbourne, as residents of more than a dozen homes remain unable to return to their Mornington Peninsula properties.

title.children: Inquiry announced into McCrae landslide as locals wait to return home

image.altText: An aerial shot of pine forestry plantations.

props.synopsis: A plan to build more than 100 wind turbines in pine plantations close to a unique wetland in south-west Victoria is out for public comment.

title.children: $1.2b wind farm plan for plantations near Ramsar-listed wetland

image.altText: A crowd of people, one carrying a campaign sign for Angelica Di Camillo, cross a pedestrian crossing towards a market.

props.synopsis: Stabbings and firebombings in the popular Chapel Street strip dominate news headlines, but a more localised crime wave could sway voters in next week's Prahran by-election.

title.children: Crime, cost of living up as Prahran head into a by-election

image.altText: An aerial view of the an arterial road and the suburban homes at Werribee on Melbourne's western fringe.

props.synopsis: The seat of Werribee is shaping up to be an interesting contest as party leaders eye the outer suburbs for key federal electoral success.

title.children: Why the previously safe seat of Werribee is one to watch this weekend

image.altText: A photo of missing woman Samantha Murphy in a formal floral dress.

props.synopsis: Samantha Murphy vanished on her morning run one year ago, and her home town of Ballarat is forever changed.

title.children: It's been 12 months since Samantha Murphy disappeared on her Sunday run
